name: Amazon Web Services
description: AWS is the most popular cloud computing platform in the world, and offers a wide range of both IaaS primitives and managed services.

dimensions.name: Data Collection
dimensions.description: While it is by no means a seamless process, most AWS resources can be monitored through OpenTelemetry, either via an OpenTelemetry Collector or export from Cloudwatch over Kinesis Streams.

dimensions.name: Data Processing
dimensions.description: Processing and filtering telemetry data usually requires you to run one, or more, deployments of the OpenTelemetry Collector (or tools such as Refinery). There can also be a lot of manual work needed in order to normalize data between legacy sources and OpenTelemetry-native ones.

dimensions.name: Data Export
dimensions.description: While AWS supports export of some platform telemetry via OTLP, it is inconsistent, and it relies on legacy OTLP versions.

dimensions.name: Zero-Code/Agents
dimensions.description: Regardless of language or service, there is good support for automatically collecting AWS data.

dimensions.name: OOTB Experience
dimensions.description: While there's some parts that Just Work, normalizing your telemetry data across an existing AWS deployment and integrating it with OpenTelemery can require a lot of data transformation.
